sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Capsule Filling Machine for automated filling of powder or granule formulations into hard gelatin capsules.
sections.scope: Applicable to capsule filling activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the machine is installed in a clean area meeting GMP standards.
Verify that compressed air supply is connected and at proper pressure.
Check that empty capsules, filling material, and closing mechanism are ready.
Power ON the capsule filling machine and initialize the control panel.
Select the appropriate capsule size (00, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4) and install corresponding tooling.
Install the dosing disc, tamping pins, and closing segments for the selected capsule size.
Set machine parameters including dosing depth, tamping pressure, and machine speed.
Load empty capsules into the hopper with proper orientation.
Verify that capsules are being properly oriented and fed to separation unit.
Load the powder or granule formulation into the product hopper.
Perform trial filling with a small batch to verify fill weight and capsule integrity.
Weigh initial filled capsules and calculate average fill weight.
Adjust dosing depth or tamping pressure to achieve target fill weight.
Once weight is consistent, start production at appropriate speed.
Monitor the filling process continuously for capsule jams or defects.
Periodically collect samples and verify fill weight uniformity.
Check for capsule defects including cracking, splitting, or incomplete closure.
Collect filled capsules in appropriate containers for further processing.
After completion, stop the machine and remove remaining materials.
Clean all product contact parts thoroughly to prevent cross-contamination.
Perform line clearance before processing next product.
Document machine settings, fill weights, and deviations in the batch record.
precautions: Use capsules from the same batch to ensure uniform quality.
Ensure powder flow properties are suitable for automatic filling.
Maintain controlled humidity to prevent capsule brittleness or softness.
Do not exceed machine capacity to avoid jams and defects.
Monitor fill weight regularly to ensure dose uniformity.
Check capsule shells for defects before loading.
Clean machine thoroughly between different products to prevent cross-contamination.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, mask, and hair cover.
Handle filled capsules carefully to prevent damage.
